resource.description: The resource identifier for which the authorize decision is returned.

authorized.description: The authorization decision for the resource. Can be either true or false.

serviceProvider.description: The internal unique identifier associated with a Service Provider during on-boarding process.

source.description: Information about decision source: degradation, temppass, mvpd or dummy.

mvpd.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

SessionStatusResponse.description: Response object for session status requests

existing.description: The existing parameters that were already provided.

missing.description: The existing parameters that were already provided.

actionType.description: The type of interaction the client application must perform in order to continue the flow with the action specified by the parameter "actionName".

mvpd.description: The internal unique identifier associated with an Identity Provider during on-boarding process.

url.description: The logout URL used to perform logout flow with the MVPD endpoint. It is not present when: actionName=complete or actionName=invalid.

actionName.description: The action to be performed in a user-agent.

actionType.description: The type of interaction the client application must perform in order to continue the flow with the action specified by the parameter "actionName".

code.description: The registration code that can be used on the secondary device to continue the authentication flow.

serviceProvider.description: The id of the service provider.

missingParameters.description: The missing parameters that need to be provided in order to complete the authentication flow.

sessionId.description: The opaque identifier that can be used for tracking user activity.

mvpd.description: The id of the identity provider.

url.description: The url where the application needs to navigate.

actionName.description: The action that primary device need to perform in order to complete authentication flow.

notAfter.description: The maximum timestamp for the authentication profile time-to-live (ttl).

attributes.description: The list of user metadata attributes. These attributes can be mandatory (userId) or non-mandatory (the rest of the user metadata fields like zip, householdId, maxRating, etc.).

type.description: The type of the authenticated profile.

issuer.description: The entity that owns the authenticated profile.

notBefore.description: The minimum timestamp for the authentication profile time-to-live (ttl).

redirectUrl.description:
The final redirect URL to which the user agent navigates when the authentication flow for the MVPD is completed.

The value must be URL-encoded.

If the streaming device platform has limitations in providing a value, then an application will have to resume the authentication session and provide a valid value.

domainName.description:
The originating domain of the application performing MVPD login.

If the streaming device platform has limitations in providing a value, then an application will have to resume the authentication session and provide a valid value.

mvpd.description:
The internal unique identifier associated with the Identity Provider during onboarding process.

If the streaming device platform has limitations in providing a value, then an application will have to resume the authentication session and provide a valid value.

redirectUrl.description:
The final redirect URL to which the user agent navigates when the authentication flow for the MVPD is completed.

The value must be URL-encoded.

If the streaming device platform has limitations in providing a value, then an application will have to resume the authentication session and provide a valid value.

domainName.description:
The originating domain of the application performing MVPD login.

If the streaming device platform has limitations in providing a value, then an application will have to resume the authentication session and provide a valid value.

post.summary: Retrieve authorization decisions using specific MVPD

requestBody.description: The list of resources that require an MVPD decision before they can be played.

200.description: OK. <summary>The response body contains a list of decisions with additional information.<summary>

400.description: Bad request. <summary>The request is invalid, the client needs to correct the request and try again.<summary> <summary>The response body may contain error information that adheres to the [Enhanced Error Codes](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/error-reportn/enhanced-error-codes) documentation.<summary>

401.description: Unauthorized. <summary>The access token is invalid, the client needs to obtain a new access token and try again. For more details refer to the [Dynamic Client Registration](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/dcr-api/dynamic-client-registration-overview) documentation.<summary>

500.description: Internal Server Error. <summary>The server side encountered an issue. The response body may contain error information that adheres to the [Enhanced Error Codes](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/error-reportn/enhanced-error-codes) documentation.<summary>

405.description: Method not allowed. <summary>The HTTP method is invalid, the client needs to use an HTTP method that is permitted for the requested resource and try again. For more details refer to the Request section.<summary>

parameters.name: mvpd
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with the Identity Provider during onboarding process.

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with the Service Provider during onboarding process.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The generation of the bearer token payload is described in the [Authorization](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-authorization) header documentation.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description:
The media type accepted by the client application.

If specified, it must be application/json.

parameters.name: AP-Device-Identifier
parameters.description: The generation of the device identifier payload is described in the [AP-Device-Identifier](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ap-device-identifier) header documentation.

parameters.name: X-Device-Info
parameters.description:
The generation of the device information payload is described in the [X-Device-Info](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-x-device-info) header documentation.

It is strongly recommended to always use it when the application's device platform allows for the explicit provision of valid values.

When provided, the Adobe Pass Authentication backend will merge explicitly set values with extracted values implicitly (by default).

When not provided, the Adobe Pass Authentication backend will use extracted values implicitly (by default).

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description:
The IP address of the streaming device.

It is strongly recommended to always use it for server to server implementations, particularly when the call is made by the programmer service rather than the streaming device.

For client to server implementations, the IP address of the streaming device is sent implicitly

parameters.name: Adobe-Subject-Token
parameters.description:
The generation of the single sign-on payload for the Platform Identity method is described in the [Adobe-Subject-Token](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-adobe-subject-token) documentation.

For more details about single sign-on enabled flows using a platform identity, refer to the [Single sign-on using platform identity flows](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-access-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-service-token-flows) documentation.

parameters.name: AD-Service-Token
parameters.description:
The generation of the single sign-on payload for the Service Token method is described in the [AD-Service-Token](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ad-service-token) documentation.

For more details about single sign-on enabled flows using a service token, refer to the [Single sign-on using service token flows](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-access-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-service-token-flows) documentation.

parameters.name: AP-Partner-Framework-Status
parameters.description:
The generation of the single sign-on payload for the Partner method is described in the [AP-Partner-Framework-Status](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ap-partner-framework-status) documentation.

For more details about single sign-on enabled flows using a partner, refer to the [Single sign-on using partner flows](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-access-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-service-token-flows) documentation.

parameters.name: AP-Temppass-Identity
parameters.description: The generation of the user unique identifier payload is described in the [AP-TempPass-Identity](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ap-temppass-identity) documentation.

The media type accepted by the client application.

If specified, it must be application/json.

parameters.description: The user agent of the client application.

post.summary: Retrieve profile using partner authentication response

requestBody.description:
The partner authentication response that contains the needed user metadata to create and save a partner profile.

The value must be Base64-encoded and afterward URL-encoded.

200.description: OK. <summary>The response body contains a map of valid profiles, which may be empty.<summary>

400.description: Bad request. <summary>The request is invalid, the client needs to correct the request and try again.<summary> <summary>The response body may contain error information that adheres to the [Enhanced Error Codes](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/error-reportn/enhanced-error-codes) documentation.<summary>

401.description: Unauthorized. <summary>The access token is invalid, the client needs to obtain a new access token and try again. For more details refer to the [Dynamic Client Registration](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/dcr-api/dynamic-client-registration-overview) documentation.<summary>

The response body may contain error information that adheres to the [Enhanced Error Codes](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/auth-features/error-reportn/enhanced-error-codes) documentation.<summary>

parameters.name: partner
parameters.description: The name of the partner (e.g., Apple) that provides the single sign-on framework integrated with Adobe Pass Authentication flows.

parameters.name: serviceProvider
parameters.description: The internal unique identifier associated with the Service Provider during onboarding process.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The generation of the bearer token payload is described in the [Authorization](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-authorization) header documentation.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description:
The media type accepted by the client application.

If specified, it must be application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

parameters.name: AP-Device-Identifier
parameters.description: The generation of the device identifier payload is described in the [AP-Device-Identifier](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ap-device-identifier) header documentation.

parameters.name: X-Device-Info
parameters.description:
The generation of the device information payload is described in the [X-Device-Info](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-x-device-info) header documentation.

It is strongly recommended to always use it when the application's device platform allows for the explicit provision of valid values.

When provided, the Adobe Pass Authentication backend will merge explicitly set values with extracted values implicitly (by default).

When not provided, the Adobe Pass Authentication backend will use extracted values implicitly (by default).

parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For
parameters.description:
The IP address of the streaming device.

It is strongly recommended to always use it for server to server implementations, particularly when the call is made by the programmer service rather than the streaming device.

For client to server implementations, the IP address of the streaming device is sent implicitly

parameters.name: AP-Partner-Framework-Status
parameters.description:
The generation of the single sign-on payload for the Partner method is described in the [AP-Partner-Framework-Status](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-appendix/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers/rest-api-v2-appendix-headers-ap-partner-framework-status) documentation.

For more details about single sign-on enabled flows using a partner, refer to the [Single sign-on using partner flows](https://experienceleague.adobe.com/en/docs/pass/authentication/programmer-integration-guide/rest-api-v2/rest-api-v2-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-access-flows/rest-api-v2-single-sign-on-service-token-flows) documentation.
